attributes.action: Remove the option to  remain in the EU from any second referendum.
attributes.additional_details: The leaders of both parties have declared there intention to negotiate our departure. Indeed, a motion has been passed into law to say this is what is going to happen. But still all sides are rumouring the possibility of a second referendum which includes an option to remain in the EU. This is hindering our negotiations and is dividing the country. We therefore, respectfully ask for the house to debate passing a motion which would remove the remain option from any future possible referendum
attributes.background: Both Labour and the Conservatives have declared that they respect the result of the referendum. But they are rumouring the possibility of a second referendum which includes an option to remain in the EU. This is hindering our negotiations. Therefore, this option should be removed for clarification.
